info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 31 at 4:25PM CDT until March 31 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Tornado Warning for... East central Henry County in northwestern Illinois... Bureau County in north central Illinois... * Until 515 PM CDT. * At 425 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Neponset, or 8 miles northeast of Kewanee, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Buda around 430 PM CDT. Wyanet and Manlius around 435 PM CDT. Princeton, Walnut and Bureau County Fairgrounds around 445 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Ohio, Malden, Dover, Kasbeer, Van Orin, Zearing, La Moille and Arlington. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
